Fie on the sleights that men devise,</br>Heigh hoe sillie sleights:</br>When simple Maydes they would entice,</br>Maides are yong mens chiefe delights.</br>Nay, women they witch with their eyes,</br>Eyes like beames of burning Sunne:</br>And men once caught, they soone despise,</br>So are Sheepheards oft undone.

If any young man win a maide,</br>Happy man is he:</br>By trusting him she is betraide,</br>Fie upon such treacherie.</br>If Maides win young men with their guiles,</br>Heigh hoe guilefull greefe:</br>They deale like weeping Crocodiles,</br>That murther men without releefe.

I knowe a simple Country Hinde,</br>Heigh hoe sillie Swaine:</br>To whom faire Daphne prooved kinde,</br>Was he not kinde to her againe?</br>He vowed by Pan with many an oath,</br>Heigh hoe Sheepheards God is he:</br>Yet since hath chang'd, and broke his troath,</br>Troth-plight broke, will plagued be.

She had deceived many a swaine,</br>Fie on false deceite:</br>And plighted troath to them in vaine,</br>There can bee no greefe more great.</br>Her measure was with measure paide,</br>Heigh hoe, heigh hoe equall meede:</br>She was beguil'd that had betraide,</br>So shall all deceavers speede.

If every Maide were like to me,</br>Heigh hoe hard of hart:</br>Both love and lovers scorn'd should be,</br>Scorners shall be sure of smart.</br>If every Maide were of my minde,</br>Heigh hoe, heigh hoe lovely sweete:</br>They to their Lovers should proove kinde,</br>Kindnes is for Maydens meete.

Me thinkes love is an idle toy,</br>Heigh hoe busie paine:</br>Both wit and sence it dooth annoy,</br>Both sence and wit thereby we gaine.</br>Tush Phillis cease, be not so coy,</br>Heigh hoe, heigh hoe coy disdaine:</br>I know you love a Sheepheards boy,</br>Fie that Maydens so should faine.

Well Amarillis, now I yeeld,</br>Sheepheards pipe aloude:</br>Love conquers both in towne and field,</br>Like a Tirant, fierce and proude.</br>The evening starre is up ye see,</br>Vesper shines, we must away:</br>Would every Lover might agree,</br>So we end our Roundelay.</br>
